responses: {"useful_question":"4","enjoy_question":"5","easy_to_follow_question":"5","comment":"It was a summary of questioning both actors experience of being in the movie.  I liked the different colors as in differentiating who was speaking."}

{"useful_question":"4","enjoy_question":"3","easy_to_follow_question":"2","comment":"It was an interview of Elon Musk explaining his philosophy on what he does.  My opinion is that the smiley faces weren't useful to differentiate on who was speaking."}

{"useful_question":"4","enjoy_question":"4","easy_to_follow_question":"4","comment":"It was an interview between two ladies, I didn't quite catch what the conversation was about.  The captions were a little bit distracting because I had to figure out who was speaker #1 and who was speaker #2 - that took me away from watching the conversation itself."}

I couldn't quite follow the conversation because it took me a bit more time to read who actually was speaking at the time."}

{"useful_question":"4","enjoy_question":"4","easy_to_follow_question":"4","comment":"THe interview was about an audience member asking Chris what he'd like to do in addition to acting.  I do find that having different color captions helps decipher who is speaking. "}

{"useful_question":"3","enjoy_question":"3","easy_to_follow_question":"2","comment":"The video was about a young actor being the younger version of Sheldon and his experience of acting along with the coaching he's receiving from Sheldon.  The emoji's aren't really that different except for the smiles which takes a bit more time to look and see the difference on who's speaking."}

{"useful_question":"4","enjoy_question":"3","easy_to_follow_question":"3","comment":"It was a group of ladies discussing women in the work field. Again, if there are several people of the same gender and the caption says \"female\", it's more difficult which woman is speaking at that time. "}

{"useful_question":"5","enjoy_question":"5","easy_to_follow_question":"5","comment":"The video was about Mandy returning to making music and how she felt about it.  Having names assigned in captions definitely helps in deciphering who's speaking and who's who. "}

{"useful_question":"4","enjoy_question":"4","easy_to_follow_question":"4","comment":"THe video was about El Nino/El Nina. Having colored captions assigned to a specific speaker helps decipher who is who however if there are no names introduced or if we joined in the middle of the conversation we wouldn't know whose color is whose. "}

{"useful_question":"3","enjoy_question":"3","easy_to_follow_question":"2","comment":"THe video is about young actors and their cutting school.  The emojis are too distracting and we cannot decipher who's who. "}

{"useful_question":"4","enjoy_question":"3","easy_to_follow_question":"3","comment":"the video was about being addicted to your phone.  There was only one male speaker so it was easy to decipher who was the male speaker but there was three women, we don't know which woman was speaking at that time unless the camera was pointed at the speaker.  and what if the gender identity of the speaker doesn't match what's being typed as the captions."}

{"useful_question":"4","enjoy_question":"3","easy_to_follow_question":"3","comment":"The video was about doing too much homework and who was the best dad out of that.  The double chevron is not necessary if there already are names differentiating who is speaking."}
